page.title: 16Kimbolton - Religion
page.content: Non-conformity has flourished in Kimbolton since the mid C17,largely supported by tradespeople.The parish church has tended to be for the gentry and their servants.In this century the pattern has changed.The{Baptist Church is the Youth Club,the{Methodist Chapel is in private hands,the{Moravian {Church} with a congregation of 200 in 1900 which has shrunk to 5 is having to be abandoned as unsafe.The tiny Roman{Catholic chapel,}the upper room of an old cottage,survives.{The Church {of England}soldiers on,with an average congregation at Kimbolton of 60,and at Tilbrook,which has an Anglo-Catholic tradition,of15.The main problems are lack of clergy (the resident vicar serves six other parishes) and lack of funds for urgent and expensive building repair.
